summary: The Uterine Cancer Study Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to study the relationship between hair straighteners and uterine cancer, with a focus on women of color. The study, conducted in coordination with the FDA and NIH, will review existing research, consider impacts on various groups, examine the role of specific chemicals in hair straighteners, and assess the need for additional testing requirements. The Secretary must report the study's findings to relevant congressional committees within two years of the Act's enactment.
